website_summaries.verdict: A brand name synonymous with quality computing, this cooling solution is both simple and reliable.
pros: Simple, powerful, and efficient, this is an actual Intel certified cooling solution
This CPU cooler is not only backed by a 3-year warranty, but also looks fantastic in your case
cons: The instructions are pictures only, without any text
This can be slightly confusing for the average user

customer_reviews.title: Looks stunning, works great,
customer_reviews.text: Great liquid cooler which performs slightly better than the Corsair H55, (temperatures are 3-4 degress lower) but i guess both are not really Coolers for overclockers, so it does not matter that much. The cooler is pretty quiet and looks great. For my taste the Intel Logo could be a bit brighter. The installation was easy but can be improved. Not sure why Intel could not have better instructions or print on the bags which bag is for which socket. For an Intel product the installation instructions are a bit disappointing. The radiator is thicker and more robust then the one of the Corsair H55.
customer_reviews.author: Jaminton

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Only cooler I found that worked on my ASUS MAXIMUS IX FORMULA motherboard. I tried Corsair and Thermaltake but they didn't have the correct mounting hardware, was not seated tightly and CPU was overheating. Tech support said to buy rubber washers to fill the gap but even this wasn't working, very frustrating. This cooler was listed on the ASUS compatible hardware list as well which is why I ordered it and thank God it works. Pros: * Processor runs cool- low to mid 30 degrees celcius * Price * Size * Low Noise * Design / LED lighting * Correct mounting hardware for my motherboard / CPU Cons: * Non yet
customer_reviews.author: Shawn John

customer_reviews.title: Much Better than Stock Intel Cooler, Tough Install
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Radically improved thermals over the stock solution with a 4790K. This fixed a stability issue, as well as thermal throttling issues I was experiencing. With the stock cooler, under P95 ( no AVX, small FFTs) I would hit T_Core 100C and get serious throttling within about five minutes. With this cooler, things never get over 62C. Very quiet. Cons: Difficult install - the retention bracket has blind nuts which are not held captive in the bracket, so they can fall out if you are not careful. If you're particularly unlucky, they will fall behind your motherboard, between the tray and the PCB, requiring you to remove the whole thing again. Bit cramped in a micro-ATX case.
customer_reviews.author: J. Michaelson

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet and a quick install.
customer_reviews.text: Using this with the Intel i7-5820k. I really didn't care that it is water cooled. Was looking for something with very low noise. You have to put your ear very close to the fan to hear anything. The installation manual is horrible. Thankfully attaching this to the Asus X99-A motherboard is really straight forward. I just got this installed yesterday so time will tell. As they say, "no runs, no drips, no errors." Only time will tell if the factory sealed system will stay water tight over the years. Only thing to note is to make sure you have a decent sized case. Full tower height highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Muehlbauer

customer_reviews.title: Better than the H55!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as replacement for my corsair h55. The two are almost identical, except this one looks a lot cooler with the blue fan. The fan is also tied into the same connection as the pump unlike the corsair which requires two separate plugs on your main board, this only uses one (the main cpu fan 4pin). It also has threaded holes on the back side which allows for an easy addition of another 120mm fan which will give a more powerful push-pull effect.
customer_reviews.author: AlienG0D

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, works great, Intel!
customer_reviews.text: This product looks great! I really like the intel logo on the pump housing over the cpu, looks very cool. The cooler is quiet. It's loudest point is on start up. After that it becomes silent and barely noticeable, especially over case fans running along with it. So far I've seen only temps of 54 degrees Celsius at max while under load. Average temps hold at 25-30C. I suppose you could replace the stock fan with a different SP fan for possibly better performance, but the one that comes in the package works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Used cooler instead of new
customer_reviews.text: The cooler that I received was not new as I was supposed to receive. The box was beaten, ziplock bags with different sets of parts and screws had no markings, one non-essential part was broken, both tubes with thermal grease leaked with no grease left, the protective film was displaced, and there were traces of grease on the surface that should contact CPU. Since I opened my desktop and removed the old cooler, I decided to install the one that I received. So far, it works fine, but I was extremely disappointed with Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: AAL

customer_reviews.title: Intel cooler
customer_reviews.text: I have installed two of these now on Intel i5s mounted on MSI motherboards. Keeps processor in the 30s. A dirty little secret that goes untold is that in order to keep these processors in turbo mode and not cutting back on frequency, one has to keep the CPU below a certain temp. Don't know what that temp is, but I am sure a CPU without a water cooler is going to be switched into non-turbo mode fairly often. I bit tedious to install, but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: A Reader

customer_reviews.title: Intel Impressed Me
customer_reviews.text: Easy install, and I'm very impressed with my first Intel aftermarket cooler. I typically build with AMD and see 50-60C temperature ranges under load, and was worried a new Intel build would be hotter. Pleasant surprise from this modestly sized device, it's silent and extremely effective. A new i7 4790k is 21-23C idle and 55-60C under load (Prime95), but the Arctic Silver thermal paste I used in place of Intel's is worth noting. Even has power supply options for daisy chaining if your board has only 1 connector. Only con I can come up with is there appears to be no way to disable/remove the blue LED's without compromising the product/warranty - do you really want kill the bling though?
customer_reviews.author: jack shephard

customer_reviews.title: Good but overpriced
customer_reviews.text: This does a great job of keeping my i7 5820K at about 35c/95f at idle. But it doesn't appear to have any advantage over the ~$50 similarly designed coolers. One problem, but it's with Amazon, so I'm not dinging the cooler with a lower star rating. It looks like I got a used one as the box appeared to have already been opened. The fan was DOA! I didn't feel like waiting for an RMA and some reviewers said they didn't like the stock fan anyway, so I replaced it with a Rosewill I had available. Make sure you have a spot in your case for a 120mm fan. I have an older case and had to modify it.
customer_reviews.author: asdfjkl

customer_reviews.title: It works well
customer_reviews.text: I have just replaced a defective Antec Kuhler 920 (leaking radiator after less than a year) with the Intel BXTX13X liquid cooler. CPU idle temperature is 32C (Intel Desktop Utility) with 20C ambient room temperature. With the Intel Processor Diagnostic Tool running a 20 minute Level 8 CPU stress test internal temperature rose only 14C (47C below the internal maximum temperature). i7-3930K @ 3.20 GHz Intel DX79SR motherboard Win 7 Pro with SP1
customer_reviews.author: PRH

customer_reviews.title: High End Cooler
customer_reviews.text: This is an extremely high-quality​ CPU cooler. I am using it to cool my Intel Skylake i7-6700K. It fits, but requires a little playing around with to get it to fit just right. Look on YouTube for videos.
customer_reviews.author: SouthernBoy

customer_reviews.title: Choose over corsair
customer_reviews.text: I'm a fan of the competitor however I couldn't be more happy with these in my dual 2697's. Quiet & cool - push/pull setup with extra low rpm fans makes these rock. Best of all no crappy software to regulate the pump and fans !!!! So worth it for that alone. Looks dang neat. Overall would buy again and recommend. Also three year warranty !!
customer_reviews.author: panpeus

customer_reviews.title: Running since 2013 till this day.
customer_reviews.text: I have this cooler since 2013 and is on my Ryzen build today entering 2019, its pretty much the only component left that i didnt have to change, i think i dont have to say more than that lol.
customer_reviews.author: Suleiman Alzidjali

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I am using this to cool an Intel I7 3930k at stock speeds. I changed the fan for 2 Corsair SP series that i was using from my old build. The pump is quiet, no complaints there. I do architectural visualization, so keeping the cpu cooler for longer periods of time it's a must and i've yet to see how low it can cool the cpu.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Ponce Casasola

customer_reviews.title: like an aquarium
customer_reviews.text: I've got this mounted on a Xigmatek Nebula case after a bit of Dremeling and putting the radiator on the outside. I only used the hardware that came with the cooler so that was a welcome relief. With an ASRock Z97E-ITX and an i7 running at 4.5GHz, it generally runs around 28C with the fan set to silent. All I can hear is a slight hum from the pump, like an aquarium. If I couldn't even hear that, it would get five stars.
customer_reviews.author: illgble

customer_reviews.title: average, wouldnt say is great.
customer_reviews.text: the cooler itself works, what I did not like about this unit is the fan that comes with it. unless you're adding another fan just like it the airflow isn't that great. i took the factory fan off and installed two of my own 120mm fans, and what a huge difference. for the cost, i was expecting better than this.
customer_reviews.author: carlos d. perez

customer_reviews.title: Liquid Cooling Solution
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Eliminates the stress on the Intel i7-6700k and Gigabyte ga-z170n-Gaming 5 mainboard while in vertical position. Replaced Intel/Delta fan with Phanteks ph-f120mp_bbk. Idle temp 21c. Does mount on LGA 1151 without modification. Solid little performer.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Works and Works Good
customer_reviews.text: Plugged right in and was totally my problem. Quiet, I don't even notice it. Unfortunately, you have to totally remove the motherboard to get at the bolts, but I'm not sure how you would do it any other way, so that's not their fault.
customer_reviews.author: A. Swanson

customer_reviews.title: amazing liquid cooling solution for gaming pc
customer_reviews.text: amazing liquid cooling solution for gaming pc. I overclock my i5 6600k to 4.6ghz and its stable !! at around 58c
customer_reviews.author: mason wetmore

customer_reviews.title: But once I put this on a different computer it worked like it should - the system is quieter since the ...
customer_reviews.text: This didn't fit the computer I wanted to use it on, but I think that is because Dell seems to make custom everything and standard things don't work on Dell's. But once I put this on a different computer it worked like it should - the system is quieter since the fans don't kick on all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy install ... Looks great
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat the compact size and the Intel logo lit up in blue is a great touch. Painless installation - took less than five minutes. No fuss, no muss. This self-contained unit keeps my LGA 2011 extreme processor cool as cool can be.
customer_reviews.author: Allan Von Werder

customer_reviews.title: I don't get it
customer_reviews.text: So I got this guy because of the warranty and it's clean looking. I've read reviews that it's a pain to install etc etc. I don't know if people just are impatient ignorant or both because installation is a breeze and the performance is phenomenal for the price. Now do make sure you have clearance around the 120mm part of your cause because the radiator dose need some room top and bottom. I have an Antec P280 and there is about 1/2 a cm of clearance left for the top rear fan controls. I'll see if I can post pictures of it later.
customer_reviews.author: shomi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Cooler!
customer_reviews.text: I'm running dual Intel XEON E5-2690 2.9GHz processors. This cooler works perfectly and is extremely quiet. My processors stay around 37 to 40 degrees on a full load. The blue lighted fan and logo on the pump look nice as well. I would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Jay R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to system
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my system. Keeps the system extremely cool and running great.
customer_reviews.author: ThaReaper2b

customer_reviews.title: Great Intel Liquid Cooler
customer_reviews.text: Great liquid Cooler , Worked better than I expected ... Running a Intel I7 4970k @ 4.736 Mhz and it does a great job of keep the temperature. with in Specs. Idle Temp runs at 35C
customer_reviews.author: Robert Sink

customer_reviews.title: looks nice
customer_reviews.text: comes with thermal grease if you want to use it its seperatly sealed. The instructions are in the box with different languages but I just watched the video floating around youtube. Only issue i had was my case didn't have room to be mounted directly next to the radiator. Solved that problem by installing it on an existing case fan.
customer_reviews.author: kev

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Keeps my Intel Sandy Bridge CPU under 40C during normal operation, and under 55C during full gaming performance.
customer_reviews.author: Mike G

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install following the video. It took about 10 minutes. Looks great too. Bought some extra thermal grease just in case but didn't need it asy case has decent airflow.
customer_reviews.author: Donald J.

customer_reviews.title: It's works great! It keeps the the computer nice and cool ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this replacement for my computer, and it's works great! It keeps the computer nice and cool at demanding gaming....The only thing that was annoying was that the power cord that hooks up to the motherboard is short...The only way for me to hook it up was put the pump upside down....Which is no issue; it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Mephistopheles

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I'll keep this short and sweet. After two hours of Prime95, CPU temp is at 49C. With Intel 2011 Air Cooler, temp was 60C. 11-degree improvement. My system details: Intel Xeon E5-2667 v2 (Not overclocked) ASUS Sabertooth X79 Motherboard Corsair Vengeance Pro DDR3-1866 32 GB (4x8 GB) Corsair Air 540 case
customer_reviews.author: Sean M.

customer_reviews.title: I like it very much
customer_reviews.text: My first liquid cooler. I like it very much. It runs cool and quiet. Easy to mount and wire. I use it on a 7th Gen i7-7700K 4.2 GHz Intel.
customer_reviews.author: P. Weber

customer_reviews.title: Also provides a cool blue light glow to the system
customer_reviews.text: My hexacore processor and system never overheats. Also provides a cool blue light glow to the system. Couldn't be happier with it.
customer_reviews.author: QPNW

customer_reviews.title: Gigabyte Motherboard
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for gigabyte B8 motherboard, couldn’t get it to fit.... any recommendations? Was I doing something wrong ?
customer_reviews.author: Justin powell

customer_reviews.title: cools excellent
customer_reviews.text: I installed this CPU liquid cooler on my old I7-3770k processor overclocking to 4.7. keeps the CPU very cool to 29c at idle and gaming at 55c. Very easy to install. I also installed on my new computer I7-7700k processor overclocking to 5.1, same temp as my old computer.
customer_reviews.author: Mark C.

customer_reviews.title: Great experience, easy install
customer_reviews.text: First liquid cooler. Great experience, easy install, low temps. What more can you ask for right?
customer_reviews.author: Avery Lucas

customer_reviews.title: So far so good Have lot of faith in Intel products
customer_reviews.text: So far so good Have lot of faith in Intel products . Never died anything on me , Mobo, CPU , CPU cooler ,nada
customer_reviews.author: Patidar

customer_reviews.title: Keeps You Cool
customer_reviews.text: It's compatible with 1150s as advertised, but depending on your board it still might be a pretty difficult install. Once you get it in there though, it works as advertised and keeps your CPU very cold.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Rome

customer_reviews.title: Working great! Keeps my dual e5-2690 processors running at a ...
customer_reviews.text: Working great! Keeps my dual e5-2690 processors running at a good temperature. These coolers (I bought 2) also look pretty cool when installed.
customer_reviews.author: keeton

customer_reviews.title: Intel, You can't go wrong
customer_reviews.text: Very good liquid cooler. I have built many LGA-1155 and Socket 2011's using this cooler and they work great!
customer_reviews.author: Dale in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: It isn't noisy unless at 100 % speed but is not that bad, the temps dropped a lot on my Core i5 3570K with a steady 38 Celsius even at full load. Very easy to install , looks awesome , very clean and it occupies less space than the stock fan so it looks cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel SantaMaria

customer_reviews.text: 3570K oced to 4.4ghz. 29C at idle and 70C under max load. Switched from a antec 620. I have seen about a 15 degree swing pretty amazing for just a little water cooler!!
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: even a novice can install this
customer_reviews.text: only difficult part of this installation was removing an existing fan. super easy install after that. and it works as advertised!
customer_reviews.author: Walt Enfield

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my Intel CPU nice and cool
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my Intel CPU nice and cool, I haven't seen my core temperatures rise above 70°C since I installed this into my case.
customer_reviews.author: Gmansburger

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and... Processor temp went down from 50c to 30! It was with the original cooler (it is an i7). Highly recommended. Looks amazing btw!
customer_reviews.author: Maykol Jose

customer_reviews.title: i own an i7 4790k and it's a huge improvement ...
customer_reviews.text: i own an i7 4790k and it's a huge improvement,also compare to my old cpu fan it idle at 30ish while this cooler it idles at 16c impressive!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding CPU cooler - temps are great - lowered at least 15 degrees
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Daniel Desmet

customer_reviews.title: Excellent liquid cooler!
customer_reviews.text: I have had absolutely no problems with this liquid cooler! Works as intended, very easy to install. Unfortunately, the manual that comes with this cooler on how to install is terrible. Fortunately, there is a Youtube video on how to install this thing quickly and easily. That said, my only warning is that the radiator that comes with this cooler width wise is a little wider then most and may pose somewhat of a problem for some.
customer_reviews.author: 3b0ny69

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Great cooler keeps my CPU temp around 30-40 degrees overclocked at 4.9Ghz. And it was cake to install.
customer_reviews.author: David Ison

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great CPU cooler. Keeps my 4690k well cooled when overclocked!!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Webb

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A little loud but very effective and super easy to install
customer_reviews.author: Bcapollo

customer_reviews.title: Great Unit.
customer_reviews.text: Great little CLC! 3770k 4.5ghz idle@37-40°c and max temp 67-71°c. Very solid constructio! Both the fan and the sink module light a blue color. Yes, it is cool.
customer_reviews.author: William Tober VI

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: best cooler ever, rarely gets cpu over 80 degrees F, and very quite. Fits in a small micro case with no alterations to the case.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Stalling

customer_reviews.title: I am giving this product 5 stars despite the fact ...
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this product 5 stars despite the fact that I had to literally study the pictographs in the instruction booklet to figure out how to install this thing. Once I had my setup figured out it was fairly simple to install. If you are using the included bracket it is important to realize that if the holes do not line up with your motherboard they can be adjusted. I bought this to push my overclocking a little further which I haven't gotten around to yet but I'm sure it'll meet my needs. I will update this review after I've tested the unit under load a bit more until then check out some pics from my install.
customer_reviews.author: FallingAwake

customer_reviews.title: Works really well
customer_reviews.text: A great piece of harware, no fuss installation, looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Kaleb

customer_reviews.text: Around 40C idle, around 50C really stressed. I love it. I used to handle +60C temps. with air cooling. Working above an i5 3570K (not OC). The computer's working on usually 31C environment. THUS is was an issue to make it fit on my rig. It's a oneway only possible configuration, and not at first sight tetris game.
customer_reviews.author: Andrey

customer_reviews.title: Looks and works beautifully!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for watercooling begginers, it's already pre-filled. All about plug and play. Makes my blue setup look perfect, just wish I could manage my cables better, but thats another story. Keeps the CPU cool enough, but don't expect miracles, it's just a tad better than fan heat dispersers. When installing make sure you don't misplace the 4 metal pins that go inside the screws, gives it the extra lift to install correctly, otherwise you're gonna have a bad time.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Zelaya Claros

customer_reviews.title: ... figured out how to get it mounted it was great, the instruction book is like playing pictionary with ...
customer_reviews.text: After I figured out how to get it mounted it was great, the instruction book is like playing pictionary with retards. But will confirm does mount on lga1151 and works flawlessly. And ill also make note that there is a step by step tutorial on YouTube follow the one for the 1155 if you have the lga1151
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Benesh

customer_reviews.title: Nice Water cooling system
customer_reviews.text: It look great in my tower. It did fit very well. Run very good. Got lucky with it. It match same color to my ASUS P9X79LE Motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Coyne

customer_reviews.title: Great water cooler
customer_reviews.text: These work great. I have installed them on three computers and tested thoroughly. Under high load my cpu maxes out at 140° f. Tested vigorously with zcpu bench tests.
customer_reviews.author: MXDuke

customer_reviews.title: The blue led fan and Intel logo look great with my simular colored build
customer_reviews.text: Quite and functional. The blue led fan and Intel logo look great with my simular colored build!
customer_reviews.author: Ant

customer_reviews.title: Pump was smoking, fan was noisy...
customer_reviews.text: The moment I fired this thing up the pump shorted out on itself and that was the last of it. On top of that the fan for the radiator is INCREDIBLY loud with a harsh clicking noise. I bought this because it was intel certified... dont make my mistake. I am very disappointed in the quality of this cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: I had to add a star.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is already not functioning at all...been about two months..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Measure twice and fit some
customer_reviews.text: Did not fit my motherboard/CPU which it claimed to support. Harray for free returns and refunds.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Campisi

customer_reviews.title: Will NOT fit HP Envy 800-060
customer_reviews.text: A very quality unit, but I was disappointed to fond out that the radiator will not fit inside this case. The OEM case exhaust fan is smaller than average, due to the compact size of the case. Therefore, not enough space for the radiator. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

product_meta.title: Intel Motherboard Liquid Cooler - BXTS13X
product_meta.description: The Intel BXTS13X High Performance Liquid Cooler provides powerful effective cooling for your LGA2011 system. This is an Intel certified cooling solution and also comes with brackets for LGA115x and LGA1366.
feature_bullets: Provides powerful effective cooling for your LGA2011 system.
This is an Intel certified cooling solution
Comes with brackets for LGA115x and LGA1366. Backed by a 3 year warranty.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars156 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
